title: <I>Ding<I> (ritual food vessel)
description: Low, narrow flanges, corresponding to the legs, form the central ridges in t\'ao-t\'ieh figures on a ground of squared spirals. The t\'ao-t\'ieh of the belly is the ordinary, bodied type with C-shaped horns, hooked forehead shield, and strongly protruding eyes. It is flanked by vertical gaping dragons. Dragonized t\'ao-t\'ieh, the halves fromed as winged dragons, appear on a ground of squared spirals in the neck belt. Patina green with patches of red.
